channel.title: Wade Allen on First Baptist Church Muncie
channel.description: Recent content in Wade Allen on First Baptist Church Muncie

item.title: Candlelight Communion Virtual Service
item.description: As we come to the final worship celebration of the season of Advent, we light the white Christ candle.

item.title: Mary
item.description: In this final Sunday of Advent, we consider the extreme faith and submission of Mary.

item.title: Beauty for Ashes
item.description: The prophet speaks of the coming Messiah as one who will seal the covenant of God with His people.

item.title: Revealed Glory
item.description: In this season of Advent, we celebrate the coming of Jesus.

item.title: A Thankful Heart: Part 3
item.description: As we approach Thanksgiving this week, it might be easy to lament the many trials of 2020.

item.title: A Thankful Heart: Part 2
item.description: As we continue a brief series on gratitude, we consider Mary’s heart of thankfulness expressed in her response to the news of her pregnancy.

item.title: A Thankful Heart: Part 1
item.description: The psalmist in chapter 107 instructs the reader to thank God for his intense love and marvelous deeds.

item.title: Thanking God in the Difficult
item.description: As we think back on this year, there have been many disappointments.

item.title: Plank Eye
item.description: As Jesus instructs his followers in Kingdom living, he uses a dramatic illustration.

item.title: Judging Others
item.description: We come this Sunday to our last passage from our Sermon on the Mount series.

item.title: Worry
item.description: Jesus uses tangible, visible illustrations to remind us of God’s provision in our lives.

item.title: One Day at a Time
item.description: As we continue to learn what it means to live in the Kingdom of God, Jesus addresses our concern for daily provisions.

item.title: Treasure
item.description: Jesus instructs us to be careful where we place our stockpiles, our treasures.

item.title: Storing Treasure
item.description: As we continue to work out way through Matthew 6, we come, this week, to a familiar passage.

item.title: Fasting 101
item.description: Jesus continues to challenge the motives of our spiritual practices.

item.title: Motivation
item.description: Thank you to Caleb Rolling for preaching on Sunday.

item.title: The Secret Place
item.description: As we continue in our series on the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus challenges our motivation in giving and praying.

item.title: In Secret
item.description: This past Sunday, we jumped back into our series on the Sermon on the Mount.

item.title: Loving Our Enemies
item.description: Jesus continues to challenge us in the Sermon on the Mount.

item.title: Loving Enemies
item.description: It was truly a joy to work with you through Paul’s letter to the church at Philippi over the past 11 weeks.

item.title: Thank You
item.description: As Paul closes his letter to the church at Philippi.

item.title: Proper Gratitude
item.description: We come this week to last sermon in our series on Paul’s letter to the church at Philippi.

item.title: Whatever Is
item.description: As Paul instructs the church at Philippi to resist anxiety and accept the peace of God, he urges them to consider what they observe and meditate upon.

item.title: Toward Peace
item.description: This past Sunday, I initially planned to cover Philippians 4:4-9.

item.title: Anxiety
item.description: Paul’s imprisonment is a difficult life circumstance; he is not sure if he will make it out alive.

item.title: Anxious Times
item.description: As we move toward the end of our study in Philippians (2 more weeks), we come to one of my favorite verses this week.

item.title: Unity
item.description: As we flip over to chapter 4 in our Philippians study, Paul addresses the church with deep affection.

item.title: Making Up
item.description: It has been wonderful working through Philippians with you for the past several weeks.

item.title: Imitators
item.description: Paul has learned to reframe his perspective.

item.title: Copy Me
item.description: This past Sunday, we had a few technical issues with the live stream.

item.title: Friend of the Cross
item.description: Paul calls out the methods of false teachers, highlights his resume in light of their tactics, but quickly crumbles it up and throws it away.

item.title: Knowing Jesus
item.description: This past Sunday was the first Sunday back in the building.

item.title: Models for Ministry
item.description: The final verses in Philippians 2 (19-30) could be seen as minor instructions pertaining to Paul’s companions.

item.title: Timothy and Epaphroditus
item.description: This Sunday is the first Sunday in August.

item.title: Pleasing God Alone
item.description: Paul’s desire to please God far outweighs his desire for his own comfort, status, or reputation.

item.title: God First
item.description: I recently read a biography that featured Eric Liddell, the 1924 Olympic gold medalist who was portrayed in the movie Chariots of Fire.

item.title: Posture of Humility
item.description: Paul turns from a discussion about his imprisonment to instruction to the church at Philippi.

item.title: Humility
item.description: As we continue to work our way through Paul’s letter to the church at Philippi, the tone of Paul’s language shifts in chapter 2.

item.title: Whatever Happens
item.description: As Paul writes to the church at Philippi, he is imprisoned with an uncertain fate.

item.title: Advancing the Gospel
item.description: We enjoyed a wonderful time of being together in person on Sunday.

item.title: Re-framing Our Perspective
item.description: As we begin our study in Paul’s letter to the church at Philippi, we consider how he re-frames the difficult circumstances of his imprisonment as well as other church problems.

item.title: Back to the Building
item.description: Each week, I typically send out a few sentences and this week’s passage for you to read ahead of time.

item.title: Turn the Other Cheek
item.description: Jesus' instructions to non-retaliation are perhaps the most difficult words in the Sermon on the Mount.

item.title: Giving to the Enemy
item.description: Jesus' words in the Sermon on the Mount are not easy.

item.title: Honesty
item.description: In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus forbids his followers from swearing.

item.title: Honest
item.description: As we continue our series on the Sermon on the Mount, we also celebrate Father’s Day.

item.title: Divorce
item.description: Marriage and divorce are important and complicated issues throughout the Bible.

item.title: Ending Marriage
item.description: Have you or someone that is close to you experienced the pain of divorce?

item.title: Wisdom in the Chaos
item.description: This has not been an easy year.

item.title: Chaos
item.description: Over the past few months, we have all experienced tremendous life-altering events in our community, country, and world.

item.title: Lust or Love
item.description: Jesus calls his followers to radical adherence to the Law.

item.title: Elevating Lust
item.description: This week we come to our sixth week of our Sermon on the Mount series.

item.title: Anger
item.description: As Jesus expands and fulfills the Law, he addresses specific topics.

item.title: Extending the Law
item.description: It was good to worship with you all yesterday.

item.title: The Law
item.description: In Matthew 5:17-20, Jesus warns against throwing out the Old Testament in light of his life and ministry.

item.title: Fulfilling the Law
item.description: It was wonderful to be able to gather live on Sunday to celebrate Mother’s Day.

item.title: The Love of a Mother
item.description: On Mother’s Day, we take a break from the Sermon on the Mount series to travel a bit further back in time.

item.title: Hannah
item.description: I wanted to remind you that we will be gathering via live stream this Sunday to celebrate Mother’s Day together.

item.title: Kings and Priests
item.description: The familiar passage about salt and light is often simplified into Jesus' followers serving as moral influencers in our broken world.

item.title: Reading the Story
item.description: As we work out way through the Sermon on the Mount, we are building each week on Jesus' words in Matthew 5-7.

item.title: Blessed by God
item.description: As we come once again to the passage we call The Beatitudes, we consider how counter cultural and counter religious Jesus' description of his followers might seem.

item.title: Blessings and Curses
item.description: A few months ago, we spent a Sunday studying the Beatitudes.

item.title: The Teaching of Jesus
item.description: As we prepare for our study on the Sermon on the Mount, we explore how to read this ever important section of Matthew’s gospel.

item.title: Hillside Sermon
item.description: The participation in our Resurrection Sunday live stream was wonderful.

item.title: Risen
item.description: It is Resurrection Sunday and we gather to celebrate the Risen Christ.

item.title: Holy Week
item.description: I could not be more pleased with the way that we are functioning in this season of social distancing.

item.title: Palm Sunday
item.description: As we begin Holy Week, we will walk through the story of Jesus' arrest and crucifixion.

item.title: Palm Sunday
item.description: I hope this blog entry finds you well.

item.title: Surrender: Our Will
item.description: As we venture with Jesus into the Garden of Gethsemane, we explore Jesus' courageous prayer in contract to the failings of the disciples.

item.title: The Garden Prayer
item.description: It has been quite the week, wouldn’t you agree?

item.title: Surrender: Resources
item.description: The story of the rich young man in Matthew 19 challenges our understanding of wealth.

item.title: Impossible Request
item.description: This week has been quite the week.

item.title: Surrender Our Fear
item.description: In this video podcast, our pastor addresses the congregation at First Baptist Church in Muncie in the wake of the 2020 Coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Surrendering Our Money
item.description: This past Sunday was a wonderful celebration of children, baptism, and Northern Seminary.

item.title: Children
item.description: As we approach the second Sunday in the season of Lent, we are anticipating a wonderful worship service.

item.title: Surrender: Forgiveness
item.description: Peter asks Jesus an honest question.

item.title: To Forgive
item.description: This Sunday is the first Sunday in the season of Lent.

item.title: The Transfiguration
item.description: The season of Epiphany ends with the story of the Transfiguration.

item.title: Transfiguration Sunday
item.description: This Sunday is last Sunday in the season of Epiphany.

item.title: The Heart
item.description: In the season of Valentine’s Day, we think a lot about hearts.

item.title: Outward Appearances
item.description: We continue to work our way through Matthew’s gospel in this season of Epiphany.

item.title: Well Seasoned
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-16, Jesus challenges His followers to be salt and light.

item.title: Impacting Our World
item.description: Through the season of Epiphany, we have been moving together in the life of Jesus.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount
item.description: Jesus gathers his disciples on a mountainside to teach them about true happiness.

item.title: Blessed
item.description: I was greatly encouraged by the response on Sunday morning.

item.title: Leave Your Nets
item.description: In Matthew 4:12-23 Jesus leaves his hometown to begin his ministry.

item.title: Suprise Calling
item.description: I would like to thank Caleb Rolling for preaching this past weekend.

item.title: A Lesson in Humility
item.description: John the Baptist was deemed the greatest man every born by Jesus.

item.title: Baptism
item.description: As we continue to move through the season of Epiphany, we come to one of first stories recorded in Jesus' adult life.

item.title: Way of the Wise Men
item.description: On this first Sunday of Epiphany, we consider the journey of the wise men.

item.title: Magi
item.description: I hope that you all had a wonderful new year.
